title: Cookies and Sit Data

title: How can version 98.0 be very outdated ??
content:
I have been having problems accessing part of a membership site. Can't get past the first step, it doesn't work for me.

Kubuntu 20.04.4 LTS Release: 20.04 Codename: focal Firefox Version 98.0 (64 bit)

Have been informed from the website owner that the IT person has tested this with Explorer, Safari and Chrome, and all work. The IT support person then goes on to state - "....... that the client needs to use a different browser as Firefox is very outdated."

So, I was using the latest version and it is "very outdated"  ???

How can I respond ? Is there a training course for the IT person to deepen their skill level ?
creator: oygle

title: When I down load a attachement in by emails why does it automatic down load to my desk top
content:
When I download an attachment from my emails, why does it automatically download to my desktop when it opens? I think it all started when I did an update with Firefox? So all the attachments that I opened up all week are on my desktop, and I did not realize it :( I usually click on the arrow on the attachment I open it up in Adobe Reader, then if I want to save it to 

the desktop, I do Save As.

I went to settings tried everything still on the desktop. Please tell me what to change, PLEASE!
creator: patty8

title: Firefox 98.0.1 (64bit) using more than 8GB of memory and freezes internet
content: Firefox is becoming more and more buggy and more unstable using more than 8Gb of ram in either the apps processes or if not there then in the background processes and when you look into the firefox task manager it reports it is using no more than maybe 100 MB of ram the only way to stop it is to close the one process that is using all the memory. when i investigate using the about:memory function it tries to tell me that it is an extension using the memory but if i disable the 2 extensions i use and reload the measure memory it still is using exactly the same amount of memory. is there any sort of fix for this because i am getting sick of having to have the windows task manager open to close the rogue process every time i use my browser
creator: whiteshark68

title: Log-In to Facebook
content: The last 2 days I've tried to log into Facebook, my picture is not on log-in page the way it always is, flag #1. It will let me log into Facebook, but when I get there and try to do something, it logs me out,then the log-in pop-up is constantly asking me to log-in, I click on log-in, and it pops-up again asking me to log-in. This has something to do with my picture being missing on the Facebook log-in page. Because when I use my Google Chrome to log-in to Facebook, my picture is on the log-in page and everything works fine. But I like using Firefox on Facebook to play my games. I contacted Facebook, but haven't heard back from them. Are they mad at Firefox and causing problems with log-ins? Do I need to uninstall Firefox and re-install, somebody please help I want Firefox for Facebook please. Thanks Linda
creator: farskapeluver

title: Descargas
content: En esta ultima actualización, cualquier contenido que abro, ya sea alguna imagen o documento de whatsapp o de alguna pagina de internet, me descarga dicho archivo y lo guarda en mi computadora, cuando antes no lo hacía, Dentro de las preferencias tengo seleccionado que no haga descargas automáticas, y para cada tipo de archivo pongo la instrucción de que se abra en el programa correspondiente, pero aún así, me guarda los archivos en mi computadora. No quiero esto, justamente por esta razón uso Firefox en lugar de Chrome y ahora están igual. Creo que me regresaré a Edge en lo que arreglan esta situación.
creator: najartsg

title: TIF files only have save option (not open) after last update
content:
Since the last update .tif files won't open in default application on download anymore, I can only save them. Jpg and pdf files I can set a preference in settings to open or save, but there is no option to set a preference for tif files.

For my work I use databases with many tif files I need to open to review, and I really don't want to waste time saving every single file, then open them for review before going and deleting the unwanted ones.

Until the most recent update any image files just opened in my default application and I could save from there if I wanted.

This seems like a pointless change with no benefits and only disadvantages, can it be fixed?
creator: impossiben

title: Firefox is saving torrent files in downloads when told to open them.
content: Firefox is saving torrent files in downloads when told to open them. It uses the correct program to open them too, but I don't need it to be saving them, it creates a lot of clutter. Any idea how to correct this? It didn't use to do this.
creator: uvires1

title: Many sites load slowly or time out
content:
I've had a problem recently with some sites (such as support.apple.com, but also others) loading very slowly or not loading at all.

  • Restarting Firefox fixes it for a short while
  • I've tried changing to No Proxy from Use System Proxy Settings - this, like restarting, helped for a short while
  • Unchecking DNS over HTTPS: DID resolve the problem but I'm curious as to why. I enable it with Safari with no problem.
creator: finches

title: Google Visited Links Color
content:
I'm looking for a reliable way to mark Google visited links

This seems to work everywhere but google

a:visited { 

   color: FF0000;

}

"Custom Google Visited Link Color" seems to work sometimes, but the page needs to be refreshed. No support site. https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/google-link-color/?utm_source=addons.mozilla.org&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=search
creator: noel_envoide
